title: Bank of Canada Governor Says High Inflation Could Be More Persistent Than Anticipated
sub_head: Tiff Macklem says inflation rate likely to remain above bank’s target range for the remainder of 2021
body:
Bank of Canada Gov. Tiff Macklem said Thursday that Canada’s high inflation rate is largely related to the unique circumstances of the Covid-19 pandemic, although there is a risk it could be more persistent than policy makers had anticipated.
Speaking at an event hosted by the Council on Foreign Relations, Mr. Macklem said Canada’s annual inflation rate, which came in at 4.1% in August, is likely to remain above the central bank’s target range of 1% to 3% for the remainder of this year. He said that is largely the result of...
